Generic genetic algorithm

This library provides the basic functions for running a Genetic Algorithm (GA), but the user is required to setup the fitness function and related functions. More...

Detailed Description

This library provides the basic functions for running a Genetic Algorithm (GA), but the user is required to setup the fitness function and related functions.

The user MUST define: 1) a struct that represents an "individual" 2) a function that returns the fitness of an individual 3) a mutation function that randomly alters an individual 4) a function to free an individual 5) a function to clone an individual

The following function definition is optional but highly recommended: 1) a crossover function to make a new individual from two individuals

The following functions definitions are entirely optional: 1) A function that selects individuals using fitness as probabilities (library provides one by default) 2) A callback function can be used to examine or terminate the GA at any iteration

The main functions are: GAinit and GArun

Typedef Documentation

typedef int(* GACallbackFnc)(int iter, GApopulation, int popSz)

Callback function. If not null, then this function is called during each iteration of the GA. This function can be used to terminate the GA at any step.

Parameters:
iteration 
GApopulation of individuals
number of individuals in the population
Returns:
0 = continue GA, 1 = stop GA. This can be used to stop the GA before it reaches max iterations

typedef GAindividual(* GACloneFnc)(GAindividual)

Make a copy of an individual and return the memory pointer.

Parameters:
target individual

typedef GAindividual(* GACrossoverFnc)(GAindividual, GAindividual)

combine two individuals to generate a new individual. The function must not delete the parent individuals.

Parameters:
parent individual 1
parent individual 2
Returns:
pointer to an individual (can be the same as one of the parents)

typedef void(* GADeleteFnc)(GAindividual)

Free an individual from memory.

Parameters:
a single individual

typedef double(* GAFitnessFnc)(GAindividual)

Compute fitness of an individual. Fitness must be positive if default selection function is used.

Parameters:
target individual
Returns:
fitness (double) of the individual (MUST BE POSITIVE if default selection function is used)

typedef GAindividual(* GAMutateFnc)(GAindividual)

Change an individual randomly. If a new individual is created, then this function must delete (free) the old one.

Parameters:
parent individual
Returns:
pointer to an individual (can be the same as the parent)

typedef int(* GASelectionFnc)(GApopulation, double *, double, int)

Selection function. If null, then a default selection function is provided that linearly converts fitness values to probabilities.

Parameters:
GApopulation of individuals
array of fitness values for the individuals
total fitness (sum of all fitness values)
number of individuals in the population
Returns:
index (in population vector) of the individual to select

int  ,
int  ,
short   
)

Generates the next population from current population.

Parameters:
array of individuals
number of individual in population currently
number of individual in the new population (returned array)
0 = delete old population, 1 = keep old population (warning: user must delete it later)
Returns:
new array of individual (size = 3rd parameter)

GApopulation GArun ( GApopulation  ,
int  sz0,
int  sz1,
int  maxIter,
GACallbackFnc   
)

The main GA loop. Must call GAinit before calling GArun. Uses GAnextGen to make new generation of individuals.

Parameters:
initial population (array of individuals)
number of individuals in the initial population
number of individuals to be kept in the successive populations (will affect speed of GA)
total number of generations
callback function pointer (can be 0)
Returns:
final array of individuals (sorted by fitness)
